title: Dan Biggar's head injuries should stop him playing in World Cup quarter-final, insists France coach Jacques Brunel
text:
France and Wales have traded pointed remarks over the fitness of Welsh fly-half Dan Biggar, who has been cleared to play in the quarter-final on Sunday despite having already suffered two blows to the head so far during the World Cup.

“Everyone takes their responsibilities,” said France coach Jacques Brunel after naming his side for the last-eight match. “If it had been the French Top 14, sustaining two concussions automatically means three weeks out with the protocol that is applied there. So he wouldn't have been able to play.”

Biggar will take his place in a full-strength Wales line-up with their management adamant that all protocols had been observed including an examination by an independent...
description: France and Wales have traded pointed remarks over the fitness of Welsh fly-half Dan Biggar, who has been cleared to play in the quarter-final on Sunday despite having already suffered two blows to the head so far during the World Cup.
